FuncDef:
The ipv6 address cga command configures a CGA global unicast address or link-local address.
The undo ipv6 address cga command deletes a CGA global unicast address or link-local address. The ipv6 address cga command configures a CGA global unicast address or link-local address. The undo ipv6 address cga command deletes a CGA global unicast address or link-local address. By default, no CGA global unicast address. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv6 address to be configured for the interface.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies the prefix length of an IPv6 address.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 64. When a link-local address of the CGA type is configured, the prefix length value ranges from 10 to 64. When a global unicast address of the CGA type is configured, the prefix length value ranges from 1 to 64.

Specifies the IPv6 address and prefix length of an interface.
IPv6 address/IPv6 address prefix length.

ExtraInfo: To enable IPv6 SEND to protect ND messages, you need to configure a CGA IPv6 address on an interface. Running the ipv6 address cga command configures a CGA IPv6 global unicast address or link-local address.
